name: Colorbomb
description: Colorbomb is a project that constructs color palettes from photos of graffiti from San Francisco's Mission District. It implements a k-means clustering algorithm in Python to find the color clusters, which form the colors in the palette. These color palettes are used to create map color schemes with Leaflet.js.
technologies: Python, Python Image Library, Javascript, Leaflet.js

name: Dang Pelican: D3.js + Angular.js
description: Dang Pelican is a barebones Pelican repository with D3.js + Angular.js (Dang) built in. It is designed to be plug-and-play for creating reusable D3 visualization components.
technologies: Python, Pelican, Javascript, D3.js, Angular.js, Data Visualization

name: Empirical Model Building
description: A set of iPython notebooks working through parts of Box and Draper's classic 1986 textbook, 'Empirical Model Building.'
technologies: Python, iPython, pystatsmodels, matplotlib, Data Visualization, Experimental Design

name: Words Words Words
description: A mashup of Python web scraping and HTML processing, Words Words Words color-codes the words in Gutenberg books according to ther root language, using the Online Etymology Dictionary.

name: California Education Levels
description: Visualizing census data on California's education levels, county-by-county, using D3.js and Leaflet.js. This visualization encourages the user to explore this rich, hierarchical dataset themselves, by using multiple linked maps and charts.
technologies: Javascript, D3.js, Leaflet.js, GitHub Pages, Python, Pelican
